humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which is invasive lobular carcinoma measuring 2.1 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this pathology report, the primary tumor is described as 'INVASIVE LOBULAR CARCINOMA, SBR GRADE 2, MEASURING 2.1-CM' in the 'D. BREAST, LEFT, WIDE LOCAL EXCISION' specimen. Therefore, the T stage is T2, as the tumor measures between 2 and 5 centimeters in size.
